entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Expected This Week... Heavy rain is expected over the northeast Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway from Monday evening through Wednesday. Rainfall totals from 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. Runoff from this rainfall and remaining snowpack will cause rivers draining the northeast Brooks Range to rise to bankfull levels in some
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Huslia from Wednesday into Thursday. This high water will cause erosion of the Koyukuk River bank at Huslia. Residents should prepare for significant erosion of the riverbank and high
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 12 at 10:43AM AKDT until June 12 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...The Alaska Highway from Dot Lake to Tok. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:01AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Water level rises expected from the release of the Valdez Glacier Dam Lake... Valdez Glacier Dam Lake appears to be releasing as the Valdez Glacier River is beginning to rise rapidly. Water levels on the Valdez Glacier River can be expected to rise approximately 3 feet over the next 24-36 hours as the glacier dam releases. Additional

entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:32AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,500 feet, continues. However, the lower elevation snowpack feeding the tributaries of the Bear River has largely melted. Therefore, flows

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:29AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER
